name: chorba frik
ingredients: 400g of lamb or mutton (shoulder, shank, leg) cut into pieces
4 tablespoons of vegetable or olive oil

Spices: 1 tsp of paprika, 1/2 tsp of pepper, 1 tsp of salt, 1 tbsp of chopped celery leaves, 4 tbsp of chopped fresh coriander, ground coriander seeds (optional), ras el hanout (optional), garlic (optional), smen (optional)
steps: Saut√© the onion and meat in a pot with olive oil over low heat until the meat is lightly browned (about 10 minutes).
Add the chickpeas, tomato puree, tomato paste, spices (paprika, pepper, salt, coriander, celery), and half of the coriander. Mix and let simmer for 5 minutes.
Add a small glass of water and let simmer for an additional 10 minutes.
Then add the rest of the water (or broth). Cook over medium heat for 30 to 45 minutes (until the meat and chickpeas are tender).
Wash the frik three times and drain it. Add it to the pot while stirring to prevent it from sticking to the bottom.
Cook while stirring occasionally until the soup has a velvety texture and the frik is well cooked (about 15 minutes).
Serve hot, garnished with fresh coriander and accompanied by lemon juice.
